channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report E-2023090081
item.description:
Report E-2023090081

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-24
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 24, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon pails of sodium hydroxide were damaged and released approximately less than one gallon (<1) of product to the dock floor and adjacent freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew secured the damaged pails in one (1) 55-gallon drum. HCE utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect the released material from the dock floor and adjacent freight. All clean up material was contained in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report X-2023081489
item.description:
Report X-2023081489

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE IN AT BAY 14 IN THE NORTH PRIMARY WITH SPILL CART AND FULL PPE AND RESPONDED TO THE SPILL. RESPONDER DISCOVERED A 5 GALLON BUCKET WITH A CORROSIVE 8 STICKER ON THE SIDE AND LIQUID PRESENT AT THE TOP FOLLOWING THE CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET HE CONTAINERIZED THE SPILL AND BROUGHT IT BACK TO PSC FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. THE SEAL OF THE 5 GALLON BUCKET WAS NOT FULLY ON THE LID CAUSING A GAP

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The Flammable Liquid plastic container was processed and discovered in front of the haz cage and placed inside a tote to prevent further leakage. The container may have impacted with another package that may have had a small sharp object inside. DescribePack: Small pin size hole on bottom of container DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed inside tote and under the hood in the haz cage

item.title: Report X-2023080758
item.description:
Report X-2023080758

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found after being unloaded from facility 659. Package was found to be wet and had Flammable Liquid HazMat labeling. Package was immediately taken out of the load areas and isolated from the rest of the staff. DescribePack: 1 of the 4 plastic bottles inside was leaking out of its cap. Upon further investigation the cap was also found to not have a seal underneath, which caused the leak. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to the HazMat Cage for isolation and processing.

The package contained a strong odor DescribePack: loose cap/valve DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: bag and tote. the tote was placed under a vented hood. 2. X-2023080742 SequenceEvent: This package was located on load side. the manager noticed a strong odor from the package. the bar code was starting to fade as well DescribePack: loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: bag and tote. the tote was placed under the hood

  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was set aside due to it being torn and wet from a fluid being spilled. Upon inspection i could see all 12 bottles of restroom disinfectant had loose caps or were punctured causing the contents to spill. package was placed in a plastic tote to stop further leakage. DescribePack: Caps failed and leaked. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in a plastic tote.

item.title: Report E-2023080913
item.description:
Report E-2023080913

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-29
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and hat one of the metal 5 gallon can of petroleum ether (un1268) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 2 quarts of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023080841
item.description:
Report E-2023080841

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that one of the metal 55 gallon drums of KM32 (un2920) had been punctured by a nail and had released 1 gallon of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
